channel.title: 0mfg Post When You Read!
channel.description:
Need To Know How To Change The Price's Of Items In My PK Point Shop. (Uses Pk Points, Not Coins.)
This Is a 317, Delta Server.. I Have Attempted These Many Times And Have Failed.. Please Help Me With All Of This. Thanks Again Moparscape Community BYE! - Perses

item.title: 0mfg Post When You Read!
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

Its how you coded it can be like this

if(itemID == 35) {
pkpvalue = 1000;
}
if(itemID == 2402) {
pkpvalue = 800;
}
if(itemID == 667) {
pkpvalue = 700;
}
if(itemID == 746) {
pkpvalue = 900;
}
if(itemID == 2518) {
pkpvalue = 500;
}
if(itemID == 2520) {
pkpvalue = 500;
}
if(itemID == 2522) {
pkpvalue = 500;
}
if(itemID == 2524) {
pkpvalue = 500;
}
if(itemID == 2526) {
pkpvalue = 500;
}
if(itemID == 1107) {
pkpvalue = 250;
}
if(itemID == 1077) {
pkpvalue = 250;
}
if(itemID == 6570) {
pkpvalue = 200;
}
if(itemID == 6587) {
pkpvalue = 1000;
}
if(itemID == 2621) {
pkpvalue = 300;
}
if(itemID == 2621) {
pkpvalue = 300;
}
if(itemID == 7611) {
pkpvalue = 80;
}
if(itemID == 2904) {
pkpvalue = 60;
}
if(itemID == 4827) {
pkpvalue = 150;
}
if(itemID == 4508) {
pkpvalue = 180;
}
if(itemID == 6577) {
pkpvalue = 225;
}
if(itemID == 2581) {
pkpvalue = 20;
}
if(itemID == 2577) {
pkpvalue = 20;
}
if(itemID == 767) {
pkpvalue = 325;
}
if(itemID == 7608) {
pkpvalue = 250;
}
if(itemID == 7609) {
pkpvalue = 250;
}
if(itemID == 7613) {
pkpvalue = 250;
}
if(itemID == 4151) {
pkpvalue = 50;
}
if(itemID == 6685) {
pkpvalue = 5;
}

     return pkpvalue;
  }

Or in Item.Cfg


Yea Thanks Man I Was At School When You Posted That… I Found It In Clint.java Thanks Alot Man Rep++
Nice Try The Rest Of You Appreciate It

Read full topic

item.title: 0mfg Post When You Read!
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Dastan_:

I seriously have no idea how come people with 200 rep dont know that. Their rep should be taken away… dumbshits.

If that was aimed at me:

I took offence. Rep doesn’t mean I’m an expert coder you idiot, rep means fuck all.

I have 200 rep because I put something useful into the community, and it got stickied.

I also got up to 200 because I didn’t troll around like a stuck up prick thinking I know it all.

I also got up to 200 rep because I helped some people through PMs, so you cannot see. Don’t assume I know everything just because I have 200 rep. You obviously don’t have 200 rep yet because you act like that and keep getting de-repped.

If that was not aimed at me:

I still took offence. ^Same as above, learn some manners. Calling people dumbshits off the spur of the moment is going to get you no where.

@Topic: If I suggest something, I’m pointing them in the right direction. Not spoonfeeding (which I wasn’t able to anyway) like you, which it clearly states this is not what this community is about.

Edit: and why did you C&P all that. He already has the pk points he just wants to change the value and isn’t able to search for himself first.

Edit 2: wow, you’re rude to everyone in all your posts. Also, posting help topics yourself about delta and interfaces you have no right to tell people they’re dumbshits for not knowing something and/or not giving precise answers (your answer was wrong for the question anyway). One rep from me and you’d be 200 rep, and in effect, a dumbshit like me, just how like you said.

Read full topic

item.title: 0mfg Post When You Read!
item.dc:creator: @Mod-Vlad Mod-Vlad-
item.description:
@Mod-Vlad wrote:

Oh rofl… Go Item.Cfg, search the item you need (e.g. “item = 35”), then watch how much it costs … It must fit to the price of pk points … just change it … Pm me if I am right, because I’ve just did it on my source.

Read full topic

item.title: 0mfg Post When You Read!
item.dc:creator: @Dastan1 Dastan_
item.description:
@Dastan1 wrote:

I seriously have no idea how come people with 200 rep dont know that. Their rep should be taken away… dumbshits.

@Topic; I’m surprised no one knows how to do it =///

Go to ( ( client.java ) ) and add this

public int killvalue = 0;

Now add this public void

[code=cmf]public int getkillvalue(int itemID) {
if(itemID == XXX) {
killvalue = 50;
}
if(itemID == XXX) {
killvalue = 50;

	}
	
		return pkpvalue;
	}[/code]

Now search for

public boolean buyItem

And somewhere in it add this

int PkPoints;

This

PkPoints = getkillvalue(itemID);

And this

if (PkPoints == -1 && MyShopID == XXX) { sM("You need more kills to buy that item!"); break; }

Find

case 143

And add this

int PkPoints = getkillvalue(removeID);

I think I missed something, not sure what yet. But I’ll double check it once I’m back.

P.s. change X’s to your selected ID’s.

Read full topic

item.title: 0mfg Post When You Read!
item.dc:creator: @deans1243 deans1243
item.description:
@deans1243 wrote:

[quote=“PLayRooney, post:22, topic:372471”][quote author=Perses Pkers link=topic=468524.msg3425370#msg3425370 date=1291867126]

hmm ok well look in shotassistant andit shouldn’t be to far down you should see alot of cases and returns like this this is for the ssp point shop in soul split but its the same thing.

public int getSpecialItemValue(int id) { switch (id) { case 6889: case 6914: return 100; case 6916: case 6918: case 6920: case 6922: case 6924: return 50; case 11663: case 11664: case 11665: case 8842: return 30; case 8839: case 8840: return 75; case 10499: return 20; case 8845: return 5; case 8846: return 10; case 8847: return 15; case 8848: return 20; case 8849: case 6737: case 8850: return 25; case 7462: return 40; case 10551: return 50; case 6570: return 35; case 11730: return 150; case 11700: return 230; case 11698: return 360; case 11696: return 300; case 11694: return 600; case 6585: return 15; } return 0; }
that is how it has been in all the sources I’ve seen if not then it could be in client class or playerassistant class. im sorry if i did not help:/
[/quote]I Don’t Even Have A “shotassistant” File…

His source is “DeltA” this is for pi[/quote]
we have obviously covered that i said i was sorry. pleas help him and to not troll…

Read full topic
